questions.text: ___________ is attached to the class of the composing class to denote the aggregation relationship with the composed object.
An aggregation relationship is usually represented as __________ in ___________.
Composition means ______________.

choices.label: A
choices.text: that data fields should be declared private

choices.label: B
choices.text: that a class extends another class

choices.label: C
choices.text: that a variable of supertype refers to a subtype object

choices.label: D
choices.text: that a class contains a data field that references another object

questions.text: Which of the following statements will convert a string s into i of int type? Please select all that apply.
Which of the following statements will convert a string s into a double value d? Please select all that apply.
Which of the following statements are correct? Please select all that apply.
What is the output of Integer.parseInt("10", 2)?
Which of the following statements convert a double value d into a string s? Please select all that apply.
You may directly assign a primitive data type value to a wrapper object. This is called ______________.

Consider the following code. Please select all that apply.

Line 1: Integer[] intArray = {1, 2, 3};
Line 2: int i = intArray[0] + intArray[1];
Line 3: int j = i + intArray[2];
Line 4: double d = intArray[0];

choices.label: A
choices.text: It is OK to assign 1, 2, 3 to an array of Integer objects in JDK 1.5.

choices.label: B
choices.text: It is OK to automatically convert an Integer object to an int value in Line 2.

choices.label: C
choices.text: It is OK to mix an int value with an Integer object in an expression in Line 3.

choices.label: D
choices.text: Line 4 is OK. An int value from intArray[0] object is assigned to a double variable d.

questions.text: To create an instance of BigInteger for 454, use ________________. Please select all that apply.
To add BigInteger b1 to b2 (i.e., assing the result to b2), you write _________. Please select all that apply.

What is the output of the following code?

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    java.math.BigInteger x = new java.math.BigInteger("3");
    java.math.BigInteger y = new java.math.BigInteger("7");
    x.add(y);
    System.out.println(x);
  }
}
To create an instance of BigDecimal for 454.45, use ___________. Please select all that apply.
BigInteger and BigDecimal are immutable.
To divide BigDecimal b1 by b2 and assign the result to b1, you write _________.
Which of the following classes are immutable? Please select all that apply.
Which of the following statements are correct?
Which of the following statements is preferred to create a string "Welcome to Java"?

choices.label: B
choices.text: String s = new String("Welcome to Java");

choices.label: D
choices.text: String s; s = new String("Welcome to Java");

questions.text:
Analyze the following code.

class Test {  
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    String s;
    System.out.println("s is " + s);
  }
}

choices.label: A
choices.text: The program has a compile error because s is not initialized, but it is referenced in the println statement.

choices.label: B
choices.text: The program has a runtime error because s is not initialized, but it is referenced in the println statement.

choices.label: C
choices.text: The program has a runtime error because s is null in the println statement.

choices.label: D
choices.text: The program compiles and runs fine.

questions.text:
What is the output of the following code?

public class Test {  
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    String s1 = "Welcome to Java!";
    String s2 = s1;

    if (s1 == s2)
      System.out.println(
        "s1 and s2 reference the same String object");
    else
      System.out.println(
        "s1 and s2 reference different String objects");
  }
}

choices.label: A
choices.text: s1 and s2 reference the same String object

choices.label: B
choices.text: s1 and s2 reference different String objects

questions.text:
What is the output of the following code?

public class Test { 
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    String s1 = new String("Welcome to Java!");
    String s2 = new String("Welcome to Java!");

    if (s1.equals(s2))
      System.out.println("s1 and s2 have the same contents");
    else
      System.out.println("s1 and s2 have different contents");
  }
}

choices.label: A
choices.text: s1 and s2 have the same contents

choices.label: B
choices.text: s1 and s2 have different contents

questions.text:
What is the output of the following code?

public class Test {  
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    String s1 = new String("Welcome to Java!");
    String s2 = s1.toUpperCase();

    if (s1 == s2)
      System.out.println("s1 and s2 reference the same String object");
    else if (s1.equals(s2))
      System.out.println("s1 and s2 have the same contents");
    else
      System.out.println("s1 and s2 are different objects");
  }
}

choices.label: A
choices.text: s1 and s2 reference the same String object

choices.label: B
choices.text: s1 and s2 have the same contents

choices.label: C
choices.text: s1 and s2 are different objects

questions.text:
What is the output of the following code?

public class Test {  
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    String s1 = new String("Welcome to Java");
    String s2 = s1;

    s1 += "and Welcome to HTML";

    if (s1 == s2)
      System.out.println(
        "s1 and s2 reference the same String object");
    else
      System.out.println(
        "s1 and s2 reference different String objects");
  }
}

choices.label: A
choices.text: s1 and s2 reference the same String object

choices.label: B
choices.text: s1 and s2 reference different String objects

questions.text: Suppose s1 and s2 are two strings. Which of the following statements or expressions are incorrect? Please select all that apply.

What is the output of the following code?

String s = "University";
s.replace("i", "ABC");
System.out.println(s);
Assume s is "ABCABC", the method __________ returns a new string "aBCaBC". Please select all that apply.

What is displayed by the following code?

public static void main(String[] args) {
  String[] tokens = "Welcome to Java".split("o");
  for (int i = 0; i < tokens.length; i++) {
    System.out.print(tokens[i] + " ");
  }
}

What is displayed by the following statement?

System.out.println("Java is neat".replaceAll("is", "AAA"));

What is displayed by the following code?

System.out.print("Hi, ABC, good".matches("ABC ") + " ");
System.out.println("Hi, ABC, good".matches(".*ABC.*"));

What is displayed by the following code?

System.out.print("A,B;C".replaceAll(",;", "#") + " ");
System.out.println("A,B;C".replaceAll("[,;]", "#"));

choices.label: D
choices.text: A B C A B C

questions.text:
What is displayed by the following code?

String[] tokens = "A,B;C;D".split("[,;]");
for (int i = 0; i < tokens.length; i++)
  System.out.print(tokens[i] + " ");
Which of the following is the correct statement to return a string from an array a of characters?
Assume s is " abc ", the method __________ returns a new string "abc".
Assume s is "ABCABC", the method __________ returns an array of characters.
__________ returns a string. Please select all that apply.

The following program displays __________.

public class Test {  
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    String s = "Java";
    StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder(s);
    change(s);
    System.out.println(s);
  }
  
  private static void change(String s) {
    s = s + " and HTML";
  }
}

Analyze the following code.

class Test {  
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    StringBuilder strBuilder = new StringBuilder(4);
    strBuilder.append("ABCDE");
    System.out.println("What's strBuilder.charAt(5)? "
      + strBuilder.charAt(5));
  }
}

choices.label: A
choices.text: The program has a compile error because you cannot specify initial capacity in the StringBuilder constructor.

choices.label: B
choices.text: The program has a runtime error because because the builder's capacity is 4, but five characters "ABCDE" are appended into the builder.

choices.label: C
choices.text: The program has a runtime error because the length of the string in the builder is 5 after "ABCDE" is appended into the builder. Therefore, strBuilder.charAt(5) is out of range.

choices.label: D
choices.text: The program compiles and runs fine.

questions.text:
The following program displays __________.

public class Test {  
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    String s = "Java";
    StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder(s);
    change(builder);
    System.out.println(builder);
  }
  
  private static void change(StringBuilder builder) {
    builder.append(" and HTML");
  }
}
Which of the following is true? Please select all that apply.

choices.label: A
choices.text: You can add characters into a string builder.

choices.label: B
choices.text: You can delete characters from a string builder.

choices.label: C
choices.text: You can reverse the characters in a string buffer.

choices.label: D
choices.text: The capacity of a string buffer can be automatically adjusted.

questions.text: Assume StringBuilder strBuilder is "ABCDEFG", after invoking _________, strBuilder contains "AEFG".
Assume StringBuilder strBuilder is "ABCDEFG", after invoking _________, strBuilder contains "ABCRRRRDEFG".
Assume StringBuilder strBuilder is "ABCCEFC", after invoking _________, strBuilder contains "ABTTEFT".
The StringBuilder methods _____________ not only change the contents of a string builder, but also returns a reference the string builder. Please select all that apply.
_________ returns the last character in a StringBuilder variable named strBuilder?
